unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of risk and safety engineering.
Design risk-based safety measures for complex engineering operations.
Interpret and synthesise various methodologies and tools applicable in risk analysis and accident modelling.
Apply risk-based design decision methods to industrial operations.
Critically review safety performance in a range of engineering operations.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students will review the teaching materials before the class and also prepare for the test/exam.

assessments.description: This is a group term project. Students are going to work on the project from the beginning of the semester.  Each group will work on safety and risk engineering applications with a focus on a particular industry (e.g. oil and gas, mining, cement, etc.). Students will receive feedback on their progress to achieve each individual learning outcome during the semester. This will happen by breaking the project to different tasks by the lecturer (considering each individual learning outcome), and assess the project based on achieving the leaning outcomes individually.
Students will be assessed at the mid of the semester. This will be an open book exam for 2 hours.
This will be a 3 hrs open book exam.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: The objective of this unit is to provide an understanding of principles and methods of safety and risk engineering applicable to industrial operation. Specific topics include analysis of past accidents; risk assessment methods, risk analysis tools, risk-based decision making, process safety, engineering safety, occupational safety, safety assessment studies, and regulatory perspective of safety.
data.title: Safety and Risk Engineering

description: The objective of this unit is to provide an understanding of principles and methods of safety and risk engineering applicable to industrial operation. title: Safety and Risk Engineering
